content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 2 to node 5 in the given graph is:

3->4

This path involves three nodes (2, 3, and 4) and uses three edges. Please note that swapping the start and end points of the problem will result in a reverse path, i.e., the shortest path from node 4 to node 5 would be:

4->3->5

The reverse path would also use three edges but start and end in the opposite order. Please note that shortest path may involve multiple nodes, as long as they are directly connected through an edge.

The shortest path from node 5 to node 2 in the given graph is:

5->3->4

This path involves three nodes (5, 3, and 4) and uses three edges. Please note that swapping the start and end points of the problem will result in a reverse path, i.e., the shortest path from node 2 to node 5 would be:

2->3->5

The reverse path would also use three edges but start and end in the opposite order. Please also note that shortest path may involve multiple nodes, as long as they are directly connected through an edge.
